00155 #include "BuddyMalloc.h"

00159 /* ------ This group contains all the functions used to manipulate the LRU from outside this module ----- */
00160 
00180 LRU_list_t * LRU_Init( LRU_parameter_t lru_param, LRU_status_t *pstatus ) 
00181 {
00182   LRU_list_t * plru = NULL ;
00183 
00184 
00185   /* Sanity check */
00186   if( ( plru = (LRU_list_t *)Mem_Alloc( sizeof( LRU_list_t  ) ) ) == NULL )
00187     {
00188       *pstatus = LRU_LIST_MALLOC_ERROR ;
00189       return NULL ;
00190     }
00191   
00192   plru->nb_entry = 0 ;
00193   plru->nb_invalid = 0 ;
00194   plru->nb_call_gc = 0 ;
00195   plru->MRU = plru->LRU = NULL ;
00196   plru->parameter = lru_param ;
00197 
00198 #ifdef _DEBUG_MEMLEAKS
00199   /* For debugging memory leaks */
00200   BuddySetDebugLabel( "LRU_entry_t" ) ;
00201 #endif
00202 
00203 #ifndef _NO_BLOCK_PREALLOC
00204   /* Pre allocate entries */
00205   STUFF_PREALLOC( plru->entry_prealloc, lru_param.nb_entry_prealloc, LRU_entry_t, next ) ;
00206   if( plru->entry_prealloc == NULL )
00207     {
00208       *pstatus = LRU_LIST_MALLOC_ERROR ;
00209       return NULL ;
00210     }
00211 #endif
00212 
00213 #ifdef _DEBUG_MEMLEAKS
00214   /* For debugging memory leaks */
00215   BuddySetDebugLabel( "N/A" ) ;
00216 #endif
00217   
00218   *pstatus = LRU_LIST_SUCCESS ;
00219   return plru ;
00220 } /* LRU_Init */
00221 
00236 int LRU_invalidate( LRU_list_t * plru, LRU_entry_t * pentry )
00237 {
00238   if( pentry->valid_state != LRU_ENTRY_INVALID )
00239     {
00240       pentry->valid_state =  LRU_ENTRY_INVALID ;
00241       plru->nb_invalid += 1 ;
00242     }
00243   
00244   return LRU_LIST_SUCCESS ;
00245 } /* LRU_invalidate */
00246 
00260 LRU_entry_t * LRU_new_entry( LRU_list_t * plru, LRU_status_t * pstatus )
00261 {
00262   LRU_entry_t * new_entry = NULL ;
00263   
00264 #ifdef _DEBUG_LRU
00265   printf( "==> LRU_new_entry: nb_entry = %d nb_entry_prealloc = %d\n", plru->nb_entry,plru->parameter. nb_entry_prealloc ) ;
00266 #endif
00267 
00268 #ifdef _DEBUG_MEMLEAKS
00269   /* For debugging memory leaks */
00270   BuddySetDebugLabel( "LRU_entry_t" ) ;
00271 #endif
00272 
00273   GET_PREALLOC( new_entry, plru->entry_prealloc, plru->parameter.nb_entry_prealloc, LRU_entry_t, next ) ;
00274   if( new_entry == NULL )
00275     {
00276       *pstatus = LRU_LIST_MALLOC_ERROR ;
00277       return NULL ;
00278     }
00279 
00280 #ifdef _DEBUG_MEMLEAKS
00281   /* For debugging memory leaks */
00282   BuddySetDebugLabel( "N/A" ) ;
00283 #endif
00284   
00285   new_entry->valid_state = LRU_ENTRY_VALID ;
00286   new_entry->next = NULL ; /* Entry is added as the MRU entry */
00287    
00288   if( plru->MRU == NULL )
00289     {
00290       new_entry->prev = NULL ;
00291       plru->LRU = new_entry ;
00292     }
00293   else
00294     {
00295       new_entry->prev = plru->MRU ;
00296       plru->MRU->next = new_entry ;
00297     }
00298   
00299   plru->nb_entry += 1 ;
00300   plru->nb_call_gc += 1 ;
00301   plru->MRU = new_entry ;
00302   
00303   *pstatus = LRU_LIST_SUCCESS ;
00304   return new_entry ;
00305 } /* LRU_new_entry */
00306 
00318 int LRU_gc_invalid( LRU_list_t * plru, void * cleanparam )
00319 {
00320   LRU_entry_t * pentry = NULL ;
00321   LRU_entry_t * pentryprev = NULL ;
00322   int           rc = 0 ;
00323   
00324   if( plru == NULL )
00325     return LRU_LIST_EMPTY_LIST ;
00326   
00327   if( plru->nb_invalid == 0 ) 
00328     return LRU_LIST_SUCCESS ; /* Nothing to be done in this case */
00329 
00330   if( plru->MRU == NULL ) 
00331     return LRU_LIST_EMPTY_LIST ;
00332 
00333   if( plru->MRU->prev == NULL ) /* One entry only, returns success (the MRU cannot be invalid) */
00334     return LRU_LIST_SUCCESS ; 
00335   
00336   /* Do nothing if not enough calls were done */
00337   if( plru->nb_call_gc < plru->parameter.nb_call_gc_invalid )
00338     return LRU_LIST_SUCCESS ; 
00339 
00340   /* From the LRU to the entry BEFORE the MRU */
00341   rc = LRU_LIST_SUCCESS ;
00342   for( pentry = plru->MRU->prev ; pentry != NULL ; pentry = pentryprev )
00343     {
00344       pentryprev = pentry->prev ;
00345 
00346       if( pentry->valid_state == LRU_ENTRY_INVALID )
00347         {
00348           if( plru->parameter.clean_entry( pentry, cleanparam ) != 0 )
00349           {
00350 #ifdef _DEBUG_LRU
00351             printf("Error cleaning pentry %p\n", pentry);
00352 #endif
00353             rc = LRU_LIST_BAD_RELEASE_ENTRY ;
00354           }
00355           
00356           if( pentry->prev != NULL )
00357             pentry->prev->next = pentry->next ;
00358           else
00359                 plru->LRU = pentry->next ;
00360 
00361           if( pentry->next != NULL )
00362             pentry->next->prev = pentry->prev ;
00363 #ifdef _DEBUG_LRU
00364           else
00365             printf("SHOULD Never appear  !!!! line %d file %s\n", __LINE__, __FILE__ );
00366 #endif
00367            plru->nb_entry -= 1 ;
00368            plru->nb_invalid -= 1 ;
00369 
00370            /* Put it back to pre-allocated pool */
00371            RELEASE_PREALLOC( pentry, plru->entry_prealloc, next ) ;
00372         }
00373     }
00374   
00375   return rc ;
00376 } /* LRU_gc_invalid */
00377 
00394 int LRU_invalidate_by_function( LRU_list_t * plru, int (*testfunc)(LRU_entry_t *, void * addparam), void * addparam  ) 
00395 {
00396   LRU_entry_t * pentry = NULL ;
00397   int           rc     = 0 ;
00398 
00399    if( plru == NULL )
00400     return LRU_LIST_EMPTY_LIST ;
00401   
00402   if( plru->nb_entry == 0 ) 
00403     return LRU_LIST_SUCCESS ; /* Nothing to be done in this case */
00404 
00405    if( plru->MRU == NULL ) 
00406     return LRU_LIST_EMPTY_LIST ;
00407 
00408   if( plru->MRU->prev == NULL ) /* One entry only, returns success (the MRU cannot be set invalid) */
00409     return LRU_LIST_SUCCESS ;
00410 
00411   /* From the LRU to the entry BEFORE the MRU */
00412   rc = LRU_LIST_SUCCESS ;
00413   for( pentry = plru->MRU->prev ; pentry != NULL ; pentry = pentry->prev )
00414     {
00415       if( pentry->valid_state != LRU_ENTRY_INVALID )
00416         {
00417           /* Use test function on the entry to know if it should be set invalid or not */
00418           if( testfunc( pentry, addparam ) == LRU_LIST_SET_INVALID )
00419             {
00420               if( ( rc = LRU_invalidate( plru, pentry ) ) != LRU_LIST_SUCCESS )
00421                 break ; /* end of loop, error will be returned */
00422             }
00423         } 
00424     } /* for */
00425   
00426   return rc ;
00427 } /* LRU_invalidate_by_function */
00428 
00429 
00447 int LRU_apply_function( LRU_list_t * plru, int (*myfunc)(LRU_entry_t *, void * addparam), void * addparam )
00448 {
00449   LRU_entry_t * pentry = NULL ;
00450   int           rc     = 0 ;
00451 
00452    if( plru == NULL )
00453     return LRU_LIST_EMPTY_LIST ;
00454 
00455   if( plru->nb_entry == 0 )
00456     return LRU_LIST_SUCCESS ; /* Nothing to be done in this case */
00457 
00458    if( plru->MRU == NULL )
00459     return LRU_LIST_EMPTY_LIST ;
00460 
00461   if( plru->MRU->prev == NULL ) /* One entry only, returns success (the MRU cannot be set invalid) */
00462     return LRU_LIST_SUCCESS ;
00463 
00464   /* From the LRU to the entry BEFORE the MRU */
00465   rc = LRU_LIST_SUCCESS ;
00466   for( pentry = plru->MRU->prev ; pentry != NULL ; pentry = pentry->prev )
00467     {
00468       if( pentry->valid_state != LRU_ENTRY_INVALID )
00469         {
00470           /* Use test function on the entry to know if it should be set invalid or not */
00471           if( myfunc( pentry, addparam ) == FALSE ) 
00472             {
00473                 break ; /* end of loop */
00474             }
00475         }
00476     } /* for */
00477 
00478   return rc ;
00479 
00480 } /* LRU_apply_function */
00481 
00493 void LRU_Print( LRU_list_t * plru )
00494 {
00495   LRU_entry_t * pentry = NULL ;
00496   char dispdata[LRU_DISPLAY_STRLEN] ;
00497   
00498   for( pentry = plru->LRU ; pentry != NULL ; pentry = pentry->next )
00499     {
00500       plru->parameter.entry_to_str( pentry->buffdata, dispdata ) ;
00501       printf( "Entry value = %s, valid_state = %d\n", dispdata, pentry->valid_state ) ;
00502     }
00503   printf( "-----------------------------------------\n" ) ;
00504 } /* LRU_Print */
